ext_descriptions.ext_description: A predefined_planar_purpose lists the possible values of the planar purpose.
specifies a purpose to be an analysis input;
specifies a purpose to be an analysis output;
specifies a purpose to be a shock analysis input;
specifies a purpose to be a shock analysis output;
specifies a purpose to be an assembly symbol;
specifies a purpose to be a design;
specifies a purpose to be a design profile;
specifies a purpose to be a vibration analysis input;
specifies a purpose to be a vibration analysis output;
specifies a purpose to be an electromagnetic compatibility analysis input;
specifies a purpose to be an electromagnetic compatibility analysis output;
specifies a purpose to be a physical extent;
specifies a purpose to be a thermal analysis input;
specifies a purpose to be a thermal analysis output.

A pu2ds_component_application lists the
values.
specifies a component application to be compliant components only;
specifies a component application to prohibit components.
A pu2ds_shape_location lists the locations of the shape.
specifies that shape location is above;
specifies that shape location is below;
specifies that shape location is congruent.
A pu2ds_shape_side lists the sides of the shape.
specifies the shape is of the same side;
specifies the shape is of the opposite side;
specifies the shape is of both sides.

ext_description.p:
A Physical_unit_planar_keepout_shape_model is a type of ,
and a type of . A Physical_unit_planar_keepout_shape_model is the projected shape of a keepout region around the
in two dimensions. There may be parametric data provided with this Application Object sufficient to permit a receiver to build an internal three dimensional model of the shape. If the model specified by model_shape is a member of , then the same geometric context shall be used for both models and the same geometric transform shall be applied to transform each model into the target two dimensional coordinate system. The Z axis transformation relationship depends on the parametric attributes.
ext_description.note:
Keepout regions typically include some minimal spacing around the extreme shape represented by
where the derivation of the relationship between the two shapes may be unrecorded.

There may be multiple Physical_unit_planar_keepout_shape_model for a particular purpose. The recommended method to aggregate several Physical_unit_planar_keepout_shape_model that together describe a volumetric constraint is to reference them from a member of .

The application of the same transform for both the shape model and the keepout shape model is normal industrial practice with two dimensional CAD applications where a layer structure is used as an underlying CAD model.
When considered in a three dimensional space, there may be cases where the model_shape is not within the shape of this Application Object.
ext_description.example: When a keepout is to be applied to the side opposite from the PCA component, the shape of the transformed model_shape will not be within the transformed shape of the this Application Object.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
an attribute inherited from the
redeclared as the
for the Physical_unit_planar_keepout_shape_model.

specifies the
for the Physical_unit_planar_keepout_shape_model. When the value is
it indicates that the
is a constraint on the height of other components that would otherwise be located near the component specified by the
attribute of the
referenced by the
attribute. When the value is , components that do not meet the size constraint specified by this Application Object shall not be in the neighborhood bounded by this Application Object.
When the value is
it indicates that there shall be no components located in the neighborhood of the component specified by the
attribute of the
referenced by the
attribute. That neighborhood is defined by this Application Object.

specifies the
of the Physical_unit_planar_keepout_shape_model as 'above', 'below' or 'congruent' with the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the
that is distance of the Physical_unit_planar_keepout_shape_model from the . The shape_distance_from_seating_plane is coordinated with the shape_location_with_respect_to_seating_plane. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
specifies either the , , or
as being the side or sides of the interconnect to which the keepout shall be referenced. The side attribute shall be interpreted by a receiver under the context of the component being place on an interconnect substrate. In that context the surface of the interconnect substrate shall be used as a datum for measurement.
ext_description.note: This Application Object applies the concept of seating plane to be an abstraction of an interconnect substrate surface for either the same side the component is mounted on or for the opposite side as specified by the side attribute.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies that the shape model shall be extruded from the relevant side to the value specified by the Physical_unit_planar_keepout_shape_model.shape_distance_from_seating_plane in the direction of the value of the shape_location_with_respect_to_seating_plane attribute.
ext_description.note: The side attribute must be populated for this value to have any meaning.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
A Physical_unit_planar_shape_model is a type of
and a type of . A Physical_unit_planar_shape_model is the projected shape of the
in two dimensions. A Physical_unit_planar_shape_model shall not reference a .
ext_description.note: When an extreme boundary of the actual shape is provided, static mass property calculations based on the extreme shape may be invalid, depending on the purpose.

The shape of the
is the shape for a
that references that , eliminating the requirement to provide a shape for a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the planar purpose as a . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

of the Physical_unit_planar_shape_model as 'above', 'below' or 'congruent' with the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.
